raw: * One can use the static methods {@link #onReady} and {@link #onShutdown} to
* add callback functions, in order to get informed about the ready state or
* the shutdown of the low-level application, respectively.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Low-level application life-cycle management. One can use the static methods {@link #onReady} and {@link #onShutdown} to add callback functions, in order to get informed about the ready state or the shutdown of the low-level application, respectively.

raw: * Register a callback function, which is called in the optionally provided
* context, when the application is ready.
* @param context {Object?window} context in which the callback is called

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Register a callback function, which is called in the optionally provided context, when the application is ready.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?window} context in which the callback is called
@param.description: context in which the callback is called

raw: * Register a callback function, which is called in the optionally provided
* context, when the application is shutdown.
* IMPORTANT NOTE: Since it is not guaranteed that a
* shutdown event is fired, you cannot fully rely on
* @param context {Object?window} context in which the callback is called

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Register a callback function, which is called in the optionally provided context, when the application is shutdown. IMPORTANT NOTE: Since it is not guaranteed that a shutdown event is fired, you cannot fully rely on getting informed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?window} context in which the callback is called
@param.description: context in which the callback is called
